greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of (3-phi)/2, where phi is the golden ratio.
comment: This is the height h of the isosceles triangle in a regular pentagon inscribed in the unit circle formed from a diagonal as base and two adjacent pentagon sides. h = sqrt(sqrt(3-phi)^2 - (sqrt(2 + phi)/2)^2) = sqrt(10 - 5*phi)/2 = (3 - phi)/2. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 07 2018
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: Equals (3-phi)/2 = A094874/2 with phi from A001622.
mathematica: RealDigits[(5 - Sqrt[5])/4, 10, 111][[1]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 07 2018 *)
results.author: _Joost Gielen_, Aug 30 2013
ext: Extended by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 31 2013
